content.description: This is the sit start to "Yard Sale". Start sitting using small crimps at ~3 feet and then throw for the jug ledge above. Beware of dabbing!
content.location: Middle of the upstream face of the Teenage Drama boulder.

content.description: Start matched on a juggy ledge at ~5' and then go straight up with either a deadpoint or a solid lockoff.
content.location: Middle of the upstream face of the Teenage Drama boulder.

content.description: SD. Start left hand on the small horn of the arête, right hand in a slanted, small crimp. Up the arête and top out.
content.location: One of the first boulders in the Beta Group. The problem is on the upriver, toward cliff side.

content.description: This arete is awesome! Start standing with a good right hand side pull and a left hand pinch flake. Very fun moves!
content.protection: Crash pads. Beware the tree and boulder behind you on the left hand side of the arete.
content.location: On the 187 Boulder, the arete to the left of the problem "187".

content.description: Stand start with right hand on sloping side pull and left on the corner of the lip, or any other way you can get on... With good right foot, slap and grovel with the sloping lip until you can mantle over onto the dirty slab to the top. The sit is definitely possible and will add a notch, maybe v6.
content.location: Left edge of the Charmander Boulder.

content.description: Start high right hand on a great pinch where the overlap ends and a left hand crimp on the face and go up with good pinches and crimps! Very good movement on fun holds!
content.location: Left hand side of the river face of the Resident Evil boulder, right after the overlap ends.

content.description: Same start as Teenage Drama (sit start with hands matched on a ledge at ~3 feet), but go straight up on much smaller holds to an interesting topout.
content.location: Right side of the upstream face of the Teenage Drama boulder.

content.description: One of the first climbable boulders you come to when walking to the second concentration of climbs.  The boulder is 20 ft from the river facing upstream. The problem is "ok."  A lower start to the right is possible and would probably be a little better.
content.location: The problem starts with left hand sidepull on the arete, right hand slopey three finger pocket.  moves up through two clopey huecos to a hard mantle over the lip.

content.description: Start standing in the large scoop and climb straight up.
content.location: On the back side of the last large boulder in the 2nd group of boulders. Opposite "187".

content.description: Start high with matched hands on a crimp rail and go up the mild diheadral.
content.location: Just left of "Honor and Obligation".

content.description: On the Cyclops boulder, climb the right arete of the upstream face, being careful not to use the detached boulder to your right. Exit early through the grovely Poop Chute, or start traversing up and left at the Poop Chute for a more fun finish at the lip.
content.location: To get down, down climb back through the Poop Chute or take the long walk off down the boulder, paralleling the river.

content.description: Fun short climb up the overhanging wave crest feature.. Stand start matched on ledge and move right and up through pockets and a ledge up to the tip of the wave
content.location: It is in the 2nd major concentrations of boulders if headed down the river from the Big Rocks parking lot.  Climb is on the backside the boulder that looks like a pointed wave breaking..

content.description: Start low on the blunt arete with a great crimp with a thumb catch for your right and a marginal sidepull crimp for your left. Make a series of bumps and foot movements to gain the slab above.
content.location: The arete on the back of the Resident Evil boulder, just across from the Hollowgraphic cave.

content.description: Short little jump start problem. You could just jump from the base, but the run makes it more fun! Stay left for the harder variation, or go right to make it easy.
content.location: 2nd major group of boulders, just past Point Break and its Always Sunny In Glen Rose.

climbs.name: It's Always Sunny In Glen Rose

content.description:
To the right of Point Break.  Start matched on ledge/rail move left around arete into Point Break and top out. 

  If you climb in the later afternoon you'll discover the reasoning behind the naming.
content.location: It is in the 2nd major concentrations of boulders if headed down the river from the Big Rocks parking lot. Climb is on the backside the boulder that looks like a pointed wave breaking..

content.description: Start sitting with a good right side pull around the right arete and a poor left sloper on the left arete (or use the under cling for an easier, less consistent variation). Make some big moves and top it out!
content.location: Route starts at the base of a prow that is ~20 feet left of the "Honor and Obligation" Boulder.

climbs.name: Home Is Wherever I'm With You

content.description: Start semi-seated on the far right of the boulder and traverse left. Starts off with big feet and then slims down to smears and tiny pockets. An interesting traverse!
content.location: 2nd major group of boulders, just around the corner from Point Break and It's Always Sunny In Glen Rose, on the same boulder.

content.description: Start with hands on the lowest arete edges/rails and go up and slightly right.
content.location: In the 2nd main group of boulders, climb faces towards the river.

content.description: Same start as Charmander, just goes straight up instead of using the arete.
content.location: The Gotta Catch 'Em All Boulder

content.description: Sweet climb that starts alittle high and goes up the arete.  Many other possibilities are on the boulder, but all are considerably harder
content.location: The route is located on the Gotta Catch 'Em All boulder, which is located in the second major group of boulders before you get to Point Break.  The problem starts on the far right side of the boulder on a small left hand crimp up high and right hand on the arete.  It moves up through two good crimps before moving up the arete

content.description: Located between "187" and "Snoop Scoop," on the slab.  The climb is pretty straight forward just move up slab.
content.location: On slab between "187" and "Snoop Scoop"

content.description: Start low with left hand on good side pull and right on slopey pocket/dish. Go up and left. First move is the crux.
content.location: Last tall boulder in the 2nd main group of boulders. Streaked face with several huecos in it.

content.description:
Bravo Group is the second concentration of River Boulders. The first boulders in this group are located up off the river, with the remainder being down on the river bed.  

  Routes are sorted from nearest to furthest (when walking the approach) when sorted Right to Left.
